revised_title: Geological Observations on Basaltic Structures in Northern Ireland
tldr: This article discusses the alterations in the structure of rocks in the basaltic country of Counties Derry and Antrim, focusing on the Giant's Causeway. The author, William Richardson, examines the various strata and dykes in the area, providing a detailed description of their composition and structure. He also addresses the formation of these structures and the geological implications of his observations.
